Skip to main content
Ctrl+K
This is a community-supported SSVEP measure and aperiod analysis for EEG or other time series signal. If you'd like to contribute, check out our GitHub repository. Your contributions are welcome!

Classes#

BuildPSDPeriod

Functions#

reconstruct_signal(data, label, sfreq[, method, ...])

Reconstruct signals by extracting periodic and aperiodic components from time series data.

Module Contents#

class scut_ssvep_aperiod.fooof_parameter.decode_rebuild.BuildPSDPeriod(data, sfreq, save_path_base=['__', '__'])[source]#
static calculate_fft(data, sfreq)[source]#
param data:

narray shape (n_channel, n_times) Multi-channel time-domain data

param sfreq:

int sfreq sampling frequency

return:

spectrum_frequencies narray shape (n_channel，n_freqs) The amplitude matrix after FFT

spectrum_phase narray shape (n_channel，n_freqs) The phase matrix after FFT freqs narray shape (n_freqs) Corresponding frequency point matrix

data_to_fft(psd_type='Ordinary', freq_range=None)[source]#
Parameters:

  • psd_type – str Calculate the type of PSD: “Ordinary” Original PSD “get_periodic” periodic signal PSD “remove_aperiodic” remove aperiod signal PSD “get_aperiodic” aperiod signal PSD

  • freq_range – None/list The default None is determined by foof fitting in the frequency range list, for example [2,50]

Returns:

gaussian_values narray shape (n_channel,n_fres) freqs narray shape (n_fres)

static get_aperiodic_value(gaussian_values, fg, n_channel, freqs, spectrum_frequencies, freq_range=None)[source]#

Get the values of aperiodic signals.

Parameters:

  • gaussian_values (numpy.ndarray) – Empty matrix for storing results, shape (n_channel, n_freqs).

  • fg (FOOOF) – FOOOF fitting class.

  • n_channel (int) – Number of channels.

  • freqs (numpy.ndarray) – Corresponding frequency points, shape (n_freqs).

  • spectrum_frequencies (numpy.ndarray) – FFT spectrum, shape (n_channel, n_freqs).

  • freq_range (list, optional) – Frequency range for FOOOF fitting.

Returns:

Updated aperiodic signal values.

Return type:

numpy.ndarray

get_period_psd(spectrum_frequencies, freqs, freq_range=None, method='remove_aperiodic', figure_=False)[source]#
Parameters:

  • spectrum_frequencies – narray Ordinary PSD shape (n_channel,n_freqs)

  • freqs – narray Frequency points corresponding to ordinary PSD shape (n_freqs)

  • freq_range – None/list The default None is determined by foof fitting to the frequency range list, for example [2,50]

  • method – str “remove_aperiodic” Remove aperiodic signals “get_periodic” Obtaining periodic signals “get_aperiodic” Obtaining non periodic signals

  • figure – bool True: plot fooof fit for psd False: don not plot

Returns:

gaussian_values narray shape (n_channel,n_freqs) A new PSD matrix corresponding to the method

static get_periodic_value(gaussian_values, fg, n_channel, freqs, spectrum_frequencies, freq_range=None)[source]#

Get the values of periodic signals.

Parameters:

  • gaussian_values (numpy.ndarray) – Empty matrix for storing results, shape (n_channel, n_freqs).

  • fg (FOOOF) – FOOOF fitting class.

  • n_channel (int) – Number of channels.

  • freqs (numpy.ndarray) – Corresponding frequency points, shape (n_freqs).

  • spectrum_frequencies (numpy.ndarray) – FFT spectrum, shape (n_channel, n_freqs).

  • freq_range (list, optional) – Frequency range for FOOOF fitting.

Returns:

Updated periodic signal values.

Return type:

numpy.ndarray

get_reconstructed_signal(freq_range=None, para_=False, method='get_periodic', phase_invariance=1)[source]#

Obtain the periodic components of the signal or remove the aperiodic components of the signal :param freq_range: None/list The default None is determined by foof fitting in the frequency range list, for example [2,50] :param para_: bool Discard parameters :param method: str “get_periodic” periodic signal PSD

“remove_aperiodic” remove aperiod signal PSD “get_aperiodic” aperiod signal PSD

Returns:

static remove_aperiodic_value(gaussian_values, fg, n_channel, freqs, spectrum_frequencies, freq_range=None)[source]#

Get the values after removing aperiodic signals.

Parameters:

  • gaussian_values (numpy.ndarray) – Empty matrix for storing results, shape (n_channel, n_freqs).

  • fg (FOOOF) – FOOOF fitting class.

  • n_channel (int) – Number of channels.

  • freqs (numpy.ndarray) – Corresponding frequency points, shape (n_freqs).

  • spectrum_frequencies (numpy.ndarray) – FFT spectrum, shape (n_channel, n_freqs).

  • freq_range (list, optional) – Frequency range for FOOOF fitting.

Returns:

A tuple containing:

  • numpy.ndarray: Updated values after removing aperiodic signals.

  • float: Standard error.

  • float: R² value.

Return type:

tuple

static slope_estimate(spectrum, freqs, freq_range=None)[source]#

Estimate the slope and R² value of a given spectrum.

Parameters:

  • spectrum (numpy.ndarray) – Spectrum data.

  • freqs (numpy.ndarray) – Corresponding frequency points.

  • freq_range (list, optional) – Frequency range for estimation.

Returns:

A tuple containing:

  • float: Standard error.

  • float: R² value.

Return type:

tuple

data[source]#
save_path_base[source]#
sfreq[source]#
scut_ssvep_aperiod.fooof_parameter.decode_rebuild.reconstruct_signal(data, label, sfreq, method='remove_aperiodic', phase_invariance=2, freq_range=None)[source]#

Reconstruct signals by extracting periodic and aperiodic components from time series data.

Parameters:

  • data (numpy.ndarray) – Time series data of shape (n_epoch, n_channels, n_times).

  • label (numpy.ndarray) – Labels of shape (n_epoch,).

  • sfreq (float) – Sampling frequency of the signal.

  • method (str) – Reconstruction method. Options: “remove_aperiodic”: Reconstruct time signal and remove aperiodic components. “get_periodic”: Reconstruct time signal and extract periodic components. “get_aperiodic”: Reconstruct time signal and extract aperiodic components.

  • phase_invariance (int) – Phase invariance option: 0: Use original phase. 2: Use zero phase.

  • freq_range (list, optional) – Frequency range for reconstruction.

Returns:

A tuple containing:

  • numpy.ndarray: Reconstructed data of shape (n_epoch, n_channels, n_times).

  • numpy.ndarray: New labels of shape (n_epoch,).

Return type:

tuple
